image.altText: Donald Trump and King Charles talk and laugh together at a state dinner

props.synopsis: King Charles praises the AUKUS defence pact between the US, UK and Australia during a state banquet for Donald Trump.

title.children: King Charles hails 'vital' AUKUS pact during state banquet for Trump

image.altText: An old man in a suit walks with his male lawyer amongst a media scrum.

props.synopsis: Eleven counts of aggravated indecent assault against the veteran broadcaster have been dropped in what the magistrate described as a "reformation" of the case.

title.children: Breaking: Charges against Alan Jones downgraded, some dropped

image.altText: The headquarters of oil and gas company Santos.

props.synopsis: The investment arm of Abu Dhabi's state-owned oil company has dropped its $30 billion takeover bid for Santos.

title.children: Abu Dhabi consortium drops $30b bid to take over Santos

image.altText: the entrance to a kmart store

props.synopsis: The privacy commissioner has found Kmart broke the Privacy Act with its use of facial recognition technology, ordering the retail giant not to repeat the practice.

title.children: Use of facial recognition technology in Kmart stores broke privacy act

image.altText: Jimmy Kimmel in  a suit stands on stage in front of a microphone and podium

props.synopsis: The late-night talk show's host suggested during a monologue earlier this week that Charlie Kirk's alleged killer may have been a pro-Trump Republican.

title.children: Kimmel pulled from air over Charlie Kirk comments, Trump celebrates

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Chris Bowen sit behind a table, as Albanese holds up a document. Four people stand behind them.

props.synopsis: Australia's next major climate commitment will be above the ambitions of New Zealand and Canada, but below the United Kingdom, as the government strikes a middle path in pursuit of both an "ambitious" but "achievable" 2035 target.

title.children: Australia's 2035 climate target will strike a middle path. Will it be enough?

image.altText: A silhouette of a woman sitting at a table with a laptop.

props.synopsis: Australia's unemployment rate remains steady at 4.2 per cent in August, despite more than 5,000 jobs being lost last month.

title.children: Breaking: Unemployment rate steady despite jobs losses in August

image.altText: An older man with glasses, white hair and a mauve tie stands in front of several American national and government flags.

props.synopsis: A mixed session on Wall Street sends Australian stocks lower after the US Federal Reserve cuts interest rates by a quarter of a percentage point for the first time this year, with Fed chair Jerome Powell citing the weak job market. Follow live.

title.children: US Federal Reserve delivers first interest rate cut of year, ASX falls

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Fall in FTE employment drove the overall drop in employment numbers

image.altText: ANU generic

props.synopsis: The Australian National University abandons its plans for forced redundancies as part of its efforts to cut costs.

title.children: Breaking: ANU walks back plans for forced redundancies

image.altText: Aung San Suu Ky looks intensely into the camera at a conference.

props.synopsis: One of the world's most recognised pro-democracy activists needs urgent medical care as she serves a 27-year sentence in a "hellhole" prison, her son has claimed.

title.children: Former human rights leader now stuck in a prison 'hellhole', son claims

image.altText: Gout Gout runs

props.synopsis: Gout Gout could have been rattled competing against some of the world's best in the 200m at the World Athletics Championships, but powered through with an assured display beyond his years.

title.children: Against the best in the world, Australia's Gout proves he belongs

image.altText: Tyler Robinson sitting emotionless in front of a white brick wall while wearing an armless green prison top

props.synopsis: Tyler Robinson, the Utah man accused of killing political activist Charlie Kirk, only agreed to surrender if it was done peacefully, a sheriff involved with his arrest says.

title.children: Alleged Kirk killer surrendered in fear of being shot by police, sheriff says

image.altText: A man dressed in a grey suit speaking on a stage.

props.synopsis: Prominent left-wing commentator Hasan Piker opens up to 7.30 on Donald Trump's left-wing crackdown, the Charlie Kirk he knew and attempts to have him deplatformed.

title.children: Political opponent speaks out against 'dishonest' Charlie Kirk rhetoric

image.altText: Hayley Reynolds in blue dress outside pyramids in desert

props.synopsis: As Sydneysiders struggle with the soaring cost of living, a teacher has found financial freedom thousands of kilometres away, while a digital marketer swaps the city for the bush to save up $100,000.

title.children: 'Groceries cheaper here': Sydney's financial gap year exodus

image.altText: Animated characters in a small town, a female character with large horns sits in a red dress on a bench.

props.synopsis: An exhibition at Melbourne's ACMI will pull back the curtain on how iconic games like Hollow Knight Silksong, Team Fortress, Neopets and Sim City were made.

title.children: This Aussie game broke the internet. A new exhibit reveals how it was made

image.altText: Chappell Roan stands on top of a big toy horse in a Western costume with her hair out and an arm raised

props.synopsis: The Midwest Princess is finally coming back to see us with her first national tour of Australia.

title.children: Chappell Roan, PinkPantheress and more saddle up for Laneway Festival 2026

image.altText: grey smoke rises over gaza after an explosion in the area

props.synopsis: The European Union's executive arm has made a series of proposals aimed at forcing an end to the Israel–Hamas conflict.

title.children: European Commission proposes new sanctions on Israel over war in Gaza

image.altText: A man with grey hair and beard, wearing glasses, poses with a tub of ice-cream

props.synopsis: Ben & Jerry's co-founder Jerry Greenfield resigns after a feud with parent company Unilever over the war in Gaza.

title.children: Ben & Jerry's co-founder quits over Gaza dispute with parent company Unilever

image.altText: A close up of a woman's torso where there is a scar and the Olympic rings tattooed on top of it.

props.synopsis: Making it to the Paris 2024 Olympics was a career highlight for Jean Mitchell — and the brain cancer survivor marked the achievement in a special way.

title.children: Why this rower got an Olympic rings tattoo over her chemo scar

image.altText: vogel gfx

props.synopsis: The chair of the Northern Territory's Environment Protection Authority has become a "strategic adviser" to a miner but denies he has a conflict of interest.

title.children: NT environment regulator takes side job with miner amid calls to quit over gas leak 'scandal'

image.altText: A man dressed in a suit walks outside a courthouse.

props.synopsis: South Sydney Rabbitohs player Brandon Smith has appeared in a Gold Coast court to face drug supply and illegal betting charges.

title.children: NRL star Brandon Smith faces court on drug, betting charges

image.altText: GettyImages-2234323817

props.synopsis: As he prepares to take on Geelong at the MCG for a place in the AFL grand final, Sam Butler reflects on his incredible journey back from a horrific leg break.

title.children: Hawk reflects on his horrific leg break to an unlikely run at the flag

image.altText: Bodycam screenshot of two guns in case, police officer's feet and hands

props.synopsis: Specialist officers have arrested Frenchville man John Willey, wanted for his involvement in an alleged shooting in Queensland's far north.

title.children: Police arrest alleged Cairns shooter after large-scale manhunt

image.altText: A kangaroo sticking its tongue out in the bush, very close to the camera.

props.synopsis: Citizen scientists have collected more than 1.4 million photos and 15,000 hours of audio recordings to help shape the future of conservation management.

title.children: Landholders capture more than 1.4m photos in wildlife diversity lesson

image.altText: A man with short black hair and an earring in his left ear stares at the camera with a blue studio backdrop.

props.synopsis: The charges follow the death of a 26-year-old Seabrook man, Kwar Ater, on Elizabeth Street earlier this month.

title.children: Two men charged with murder after Melbourne CBD drive-by shooting

image.altText: A man in grey suit

props.synopsis: Christian Brueckner is released from a German prison where he has been serving a seven-year sentence for an unrelated sex crime.

title.children: Main suspect in Madeleine McCann case freed from prison

image.altText: man standing beside a marina

props.synopsis: Loved ones say a missing yachtsman whose abandoned boat mysteriously ran aground in Australia was on a round-the-world trip to meet a romantic interest.

title.children: Missing US sailor was living retirement dream of solo Pacific crossing

image.altText: Charlotte Sangster leans against door frame looking upwards

props.synopsis: A patient of NSW's first dedicated long COVID clinic in Sydney says she is "devastated" and "bewildered" that it will close at the end of the month.

title.children: Patient feels 'abandoned' as NSW's first long COVID clinic closes

image.altText: A tractor and trucks piled high with belongings on a dirt road with blue sky

props.synopsis: Israeli troops encircle Gaza City as the UN chief slams the offensive as "systematic destruction", with thousands of Palestinians unable or unwilling to flee.

title.children: Israel 'burning' Gaza, defence chief says, as army deepens ground assault

image.altText: A young caucasian man wearing a green shirt smiles

props.synopsis: Key moments that led to the identification and arrest of the man accused of murdering Charlie Kirk have been laid out in fresh court documents released by US authorities.

title.children: Alleged Charlie Kirk killer's confession to lover revealed in text messages

image.altText: A white tent with "American Comeback Tour" written on it is seen behind police tape and a uniformed officer.

props.synopsis: US police have charged a 71-year-old man they say has admitted to yelling out that he shot conservative activist Charlie Kirk in order to "allow the actual suspect to flee".

title.children: Man admits he claimed to be Charlie Kirk gunman so real suspect could flee

image.altText: GettyImages-2233135814

props.synopsis: Tom Atkins hasn't missed a final since being dropped in the 2020 season, and the midfielder says one mindset helped him accept the heartache of that season.

title.children: 'Cogs in the machine': How crucial Cats mid accepted finals heartbreak

image.altText: Tahlia McGrath plays a scoop shot in an ODI against India.

props.synopsis: A 102-run thumping, the biggest loss by runs for Australia's women's team, sets up a thrilling ODI series decider in India ahead of the Cricket World Cup.

title.children: India hands Australia biggest ODI defeat on World Cup eve

image.altText: A group of drag queens in colourful outfits pose in a desert area.

props.synopsis: The outback city of Broken Hill is no stranger to celebrating the LGBTQIA+ community, with a new festival focusing on diversity and inclusion launching last weekend.

title.children: Outback city synonymous with Priscilla launches LGBTQIA+ festival
